t: Psalm 88
A Petition to Be Saved from Death.
A Song. A Psalm of the sons of Korah. For the choir director; according to Mahalath Leannoth. A Maskil of Heman the Ezrahite.
O*pn Lord,*s the God of my salvation, I*ln have cried out by day and in the night before You.
Let*ln my prayer come before You; Incline*ln Your ear to my cry!
For*ln my soul has had enough troubles, And*ln my life has drawn near to Sheol.
I*ln am reckoned among those who go down to the pit; I*ln have become like a man without strength,
Forsaken*ln among the dead, Like*ln the slain who lie in the grave, Whom*ln You remember no more, And*ln they are cut off from Your hand.
You*ln have put me in the lowest pit, In*ln dark places, in the depths.
Your*ln wrath has rested upon me, And*ln You have afflicted me with all Your waves. Selah.
You*ln have removed my acquaintances far from me; You*ln have made me an object of loathing to them; I*ln am shut up and cannot go out.
My*ln eye has wasted away because of affliction; I*ln have called upon You every day, O Lord;*s I*ln have spread out my hands to You.
Will*ln You perform wonders for the dead? Will*ln the departed spirits rise and*i praise You? Selah.
Will*ln Your lovingkindness be declared in the grave, Your*ln faithfulness in Abaddon?
Will*ln Your wonders be made known in the darkness? And*ln Your righteousness in the land of forgetfulness?
But*ln I, O Lord,*s have cried out to You for help, And*ln in the morning my prayer comes before You.
O*ln Lord,*s why do You reject my soul? Why*iln do You hide Your face from me?
I*ln was afflicted and about to die from my youth on; I*ln suffer Your terrors; I am overcome.
Your*ln burning anger has passed over me; Your*ln terrors have destroyed me.
They*ln have surrounded me like water all day long; They*ln have encompassed me altogether.
You*ln have removed lover and friend far from me; My*ln acquaintances are in*i darkness.
